captions.text: I want to ask you something but you can't make fun of me.  Okay?
Why would I make fun of you?
If you make fun of me, Optimus, I swear I'll vow revenge and destroy you where you stand!
Calm down! Geez... what is it?

I feel like things were
better when Shia was around.
I mean maybe things were a little better...
but I wouldn't say that's the key to what's missing.

well at least when Shia was around I was
actually a threat!
Well I think your problem is... nobody really gets what you're so angry about.
What's your motivation?  We don't really get any time to actually have reason to dislike you.

How so?  Because I think I'm pretty
ruthless of the time.
By the time we get to your part of the story you just smash things and yell I'm Megatron!
Well maybe if I didn't have to be reborn over and over again!
how else is anyone supposed to know who I am if I don't just shout...
It's fine!  it's just starting to fell repetitive, and sort of cliche.
Heh... I are you messing with me?
I will rip out your optics!
Okay!  I don't understand why, but okay.
Why did you guys just up and leave them?
Yes you are!  You're all, "I'll kill you!  Kill them all!"
I... I may have said those things.
You sound like a decepticon now!
I mean I would absolutely hate it, and probably stab you in the back the first second I could...

but think of all the things you can
accomplish!
I have no doubt we would dominate.

Everything is MY way or the highway with
you!
Okay that's enough for today.  I'm leaving.
Why don't you go force ome Dinobots to join you at knife point!?

comments.author: stufaman

comments.text:
IIRC from old 80s transformers, it started from a civil war on Cybertron 
due to the planet becoming near depleted of it's universal Energon 
resource. Megatron and Optimus became two leaders with very different 
ideals, on how to fix the problem, thus creating the two warring factions. 
After Cybertron became a dry, barren wasteland, they left the planet in 
search of more resources and eventually crash landed on Earth.

That's the original, non-Michael Bay story, however. There were human 
characters somewhere, but they weren't sam or anything like that, they were 
usually teenagers or children.﻿

comments.text:
I'm reading all these comments and I'm really interested in other peoples 
opinions.
My one is that the movie are great, I enjoy watching them and I have formed 
many new friendships with people who also like them. However I do see 
peoples points about the actors. 
The transformers are badass and I love them. Even the desepticons. In tf4 
the character in optimus is really shown to a great extent and that should 
really be applauded. The humans are OK but is it just me but did anyone 
else get a glimpse on Sam on that video what was shown? A Autobot was being 
wheeled to safety (it looked like bumble bee) and for about a few secs I 
say and heard Sam. Let me know if I'm wrong. 
I'm really happy to see other peoples opinions because you always want to 
know what other people think.
If you have read this through thanks for reading my opinion
Have a great day﻿

comments.author: MrAlphafemale

comments.text:
I find the Transfomers live-action franchise to be well done because takes 
skill to adapt it for mainstream. The original cartoon and comics were 
specifically created as a toy franchise for a child audience (male) in 
mind.  At the time the characters could get away with 'laser beam blast' 
and 'robo punches' that resulting in No Visible Damage and the characters 
having no emotional turmoil afterward.  This is why Optimus' death in the 
animated movie hit hard for people, death and struggle was rarely seen in 
the show itself.

So live-action Optimus can't behave strictly like his cartoon counterpart, 
it just doesn't work with 'this' reality.  He is a soldier- and trying to 
convert the Autobots into non-violent pacifists would be devastating for 
all the transformers.﻿
